summary: Stack Teacher - Multi-program career accelerator platform featuring AI Infrastructure Engineer Accelerator, AI Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator, and QA & Software Testing Career Launch Program courses. Home page serves as central hub with brand positioning, program cards, portfolio showcase, testimonials, and lead capture for call scheduling.
architectural_notes: Marketing landing page targeting US/Canada market for $2,999 premium career program
Content organized in phases: Tech Foundations → Cloud Engineering → Kubernetes → AI Integration
Emphasis on conversion elements: credibility, social proof, clear CTA, FAQ for objections
Program positioning: AI-era infrastructure engineering (not basic DevOps bootcamp)
Second course landing page (AI Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator) using same visual design system as Infrastructure Accelerator
Data & Analytics program priced at $2,999, same 8-month cohort structure as Infrastructure program
Multi-course platform structure with separate landing pages for Infrastructure and Data/Analytics tracks
Home page at route '/' serves as central landing page with brand positioning and program overview
Stack Teacher brand name appears in sticky navigation across all pages
Navigation includes Sign Up/Sign In options and links to both accelerator program pages

existing_features.title: Create a hero section with headline 'AI Infrastructure Engineer Accelerator™', subheadline 'Break Into a $100K+ Tech Career — Without a Computer Science Degree', and compelling value proposition copy explaining how AI applications require cloud infrastructure engineers who can deploy AI systems, scale cloud architecture, automate infrastructure, secure production environments, and optimize cloud costs

Build a 'Why This Career Is Exploding' section explaining AI infrastructure demand with salary information: US Average Salary $100,000–$150,000 and Canada Average Salary CAD $90,000–$140,000, emphasizing that this path does not require heavy coding or advanced math

Create 'Who This Program Is Designed For' section targeting career switchers, beginners with zero tech background, IT support professionals, international students in USA/Canada, professionals impacted by layoffs, and anyone serious about building a stable tech career, with explicit message 'No prior coding experience required'

Build 'What Makes This Different' section with clear differentiation: NOT a web development bootcamp, NOT a random DevOps course, NOT a 'learn AI prompts' program. Emphasize this is a structured, mentor-led, AI-era infrastructure program where students learn how AI systems run in the real world

Create comprehensive curriculum section 'What You Will Master' with 4 phases: Phase 1 Tech Foundations (internet, Linux, networking, Git, DevOps principles), Phase 2 Cloud Engineering (AWS services EC2/S3/IAM/VPC, cloud security, Docker, CI/CD, Terraform), Phase 3 Kubernetes & Scaling (Kubernetes architecture, application deployment, monitoring/logging, production scaling, cost optimization), Phase 4 AI + Cloud Integration (AI infrastructure fundamentals, deploying AI-powered applications, serverless AI workflows, automation pipelines, monitoring AI workloads in production)

Build 'Real-World Projects' section highlighting hands-on portfolio work: production-ready cloud infrastructure, automated CI/CD pipelines, Kubernetes deployment environments, AI-powered cloud application, infrastructure using Terraform, with copy emphasizing 'You won't just watch videos. You will build' and 'Everything published to your GitHub portfolio'

Create 'Career Accelerator Layer' section justifying the $2,999 price point with included services: US-format resume rewrite, LinkedIn optimization, mock technical interviews, behavioral interview coaching, salary negotiation strategy, 90-day post-program job support, with messaging 'At $2,999, this is not optional' and 'We train you to get hired — not just trained'
Build 'Program Structure' section with format details: 8 Months duration, Live Cohort-Based, Limited Seats, Mentor Support, Recorded Access, Community Access, with 'Selective admission' messaging

Create 'Why AI Infrastructure Is Future-Proof' section explaining AI's inability to replace infrastructure engineers, listing what AI cannot do: architect secure cloud systems, design scalable environments, handle production failures, manage cloud cost optimization, replace human engineering judgment, with conclusion 'Infrastructure engineers will only become more valuable'
Build pricing section with headline 'Investment', price display '$2,999', note 'Flexible payment options available', and messaging 'This is not a course. It's a structured career launch system'

Create final CTA section 'Your Next Step' with copy 'Apply for the next cohort. Seats are limited to maintain mentorship quality. Break into tech the smart way. Not the crowded way' and clear application button
Add instructor credibility section featuring instructor background, expertise, and LinkedIn profile link with real professional photo, positioning instructors as experienced industry practitioners
Build comprehensive FAQ section addressing common objections including 'Is this beginner friendly?', technical prerequisites, time commitment, career outcomes, and program format concerns
Create application form page with fields for applicant name, email, current career status, motivation for joining, and program start date preference, with clear submission CTA

Apply a modern, premium visual design system with sophisticated typography, professional color palette (NOT blue and purple), contemporary layout patterns, and high-end brand feel appropriate for a $2,999 premium program targeting US tech market, ensuring visual consistency across all sections
Rebuild the entire AI Infrastructure Engineer Accelerator landing page application from existing codebase to resolve canister ID deployment issues
Deploy the rebuilt application to the Internet Computer network with a valid, resolvable canister ID

Create a new landing page route '/data-analytics' for the AI Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator program using the same visual design system, typography, and premium styling as the existing Infrastructure Accelerator landing page

Build hero section with headline 'AI Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator™', subheadline 'Build Real-World Data Skills. Integrate AI. Launch a Modern Analytics Career.', value proposition listing 5 key capabilities (extract and clean data, build data pipelines, design dashboards, integrate AI into analytics workflows, translate business questions into data-driven decisions), and call-to-action button 'Apply for the Next Cohort'

Create 'Why This Program Exists' section explaining the problem with most data courses, listing 5 common issues (overwhelming math-heavy content, outdated curriculum not aligned with AI tools, too much theory not enough applied projects, no job preparation support, confusing path between analyst vs engineer), and positioning this program as the solution

Build 'The Opportunity' section explaining how AI transforms data usage, listing required skills (SQL, data modeling, cloud data tools, automation, business context), displaying salary ranges for United States (Data Analyst: $75,000–$95,000, Analytics Engineer: $100,000–$140,000, Data Engineer: $110,000–$150,000), noting Canada ranges are slightly lower, and including disclaimer 'We do not promise outcomes. We prepare you for the roles.'

Create 'Who This Program Is For' section targeting business graduates, MBA professionals, finance and accounting professionals, marketing professionals, IT support professionals, career switchers into tech, and international students in US/Canada, with messaging 'No advanced math required. No prior coding required. Commitment and consistency are required.'

Build comprehensive 5-phase curriculum section 'What You Will Master' with Phase 1 Data Foundations (SQL beginner to advanced, data cleaning, relational databases, real-world datasets, problem-solving), Phase 2 Python for Data (Python basics, Pandas/NumPy, data transformation, API extraction, automation scripts), Phase 3 Data Engineering Fundamentals (ETL vs ELT, data pipelines, Airflow basics, cloud data architecture, data warehousing), Phase 4 AI + Analytics Integration (using AI APIs for analytics, auto-generating insights, AI-assisted reporting, AI-powered dashboards, prompt usage), Phase 5 Visualization & BI (Tableau or Power BI, KPI development, executive reporting, data storytelling)

Create 'Real Projects You Build' section showcasing 5 portfolio projects (sales analytics dashboard, marketing performance analytics, end-to-end data pipeline, AI-assisted reporting tool, business insights presentation) with note 'All projects documented for portfolio and interviews.'

Build 'Career Accelerator Layer' section listing included services (resume rewriting for data roles, LinkedIn optimization, SQL interview preparation, case study interview training, portfolio guidance, 90-day post-program support) with messaging 'We guide. You execute.'

Create pricing section 'Why Pay $2,999?' with differentiation (NOT self-paced video bundle, NOT random SQL tutorial, NOT theory-heavy data science crash course) and positive positioning (structured 8-month roadmap, live mentor-led sessions, real-world applied projects, AI integration training, career support layer, cohort-based accountability) with messaging 'You're investing in structured career progression.'

Build 'Program Format' section displaying program details (Duration: 8 Months, Weekly Live Sessions, Hands-On Labs, Portfolio Projects, Limited Cohort Size, Community Access, Recorded Access) with 'Selective admission' messaging

Create comprehensive FAQ section with questions and answers covering 'Is this beginner-friendly?' (Yes, starts from fundamentals), 'Do I need advanced math?' (No, not a theoretical data science program), 'Is job placement guaranteed?' (No, structured career support provided, outcomes depend on effort and market), 'How many hours per week?' (12-15 hours), 'Can I work full-time while enrolled?' (Yes, if committed to schedule), 'What makes this different from cheaper courses?' (Live mentorship, structured roadmap, AI integration, career strategy layer)

Build final CTA section with headline 'Data + AI is not a trend. It's becoming the baseline expectation.', copy 'If you're serious about building a modern analytics career — not just learning SQL — this program is designed for you.', call to action 'Apply for the next cohort.', and urgency messaging 'Seats are limited to maintain mentorship quality.'
Update navigation header to include link to new Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator landing page, allowing users to navigate between the two course offerings
Update application form page to include program selection (Infrastructure Engineer vs Data & Analytics Engineer) so applicants specify which program they are applying to

Create home page at route '/' as the default landing page with complete Stack Teacher brand content including hero section with headline 'Break into a $100K+ Tech Career — Without a CS Degree', subheadline 'Stack Teacher trains working people and career switchers for real jobs in Cloud, Data & AI. Live cohorts, hands-on projects, 1:1 mentors — no fluff, just outcomes.', primary CTA button 'Apply for the Next Cohort', secondary CTA 'Download Course Brochure (PDF)', and hero microcopy '8 months • Live cohorts • Portfolio projects • US & Canada focused'

Build 'What We Do' value proposition section with heading 'Real skills. Real projects. Real hiring support.' and three bullet points with icons: 'Cohort-based learning + hands-on labs (live instructor & weekly labs)', 'Career accelerator: resume + interview training + job outreach playbook', 'AI-integrated curriculum: cloud + data + AI deployment', and trust microcopy 'Trusted by professionals preparing for roles in Cloud, Data & Analytics, and AI Infrastructure.'

Create 'Why Stack Teacher' differentiators section with heading 'Why learners pick Stack Teacher' listing five key differentiators: 'Project-first curriculum — build 4 portfolio-grade projects employers can verify.', 'Mentor-led cohorts — weekly 1:1s + live office hours (not just recordings).', 'Employer-aware interview training — case interviews, system design, and hiring playbooks.', 'AI-native: modern workflows using LLM APIs, vector stores and production deployments.', 'Outcome-focused: job strategy & 90-day post-program placement coaching.'

Build 'Featured Programs' section with heading 'Programs (Pick one or two hero programs)' containing two program cards: Card 1 for 'AI Infrastructure Engineer Accelerator' with short blurb 'Cloud, Kubernetes, CI/CD, Terraform — scale and deploy AI systems.' and CTA 'View syllabus' linking to '/infrastructure', Card 2 for 'AI Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator' with short blurb 'SQL → pipelines → AI-assisted analytics → dashboards that influence decisions.' and CTA 'View syllabus' linking to '/data-analytics', with card microcopy displaying 'Cohort start dates, next cohort intake, limited seats.'

Create 'What You'll Build' portfolio projects section with heading 'Portfolio projects you'll finish' showcasing four projects: 'End-to-end AI SaaS deployment (Docker → Kubernetes → CI/CD)', 'Data pipeline + dashboard (raw ingestion → ETL → BI)', 'AI insights assistant (vector search + prompt templates for executives)', 'Capstone: Production-ready system with docs & interview walkthrough', with project thumbnails and short captions including GitHub links

Build 'Impact Counters' authority section with heading 'Our impact (real numbers build trust)' displaying four counter metrics: 'Students enrolled', 'Projects built', '1:1 hours delivered', 'Interview-ready grads', with microcopy 'Numbers are verified — we publish alumni success stories on request.'

Create 'Companies / Logos Strip' trust section with heading 'Companies where our grads have interviewed or worked' displaying a clean horizontal logo row with real company logos only if verifiable alumni connections exist, otherwise change heading to 'Companies where our grads have interviewed' and use generic tech logos with appropriate disclaimer

Build 'Testimonials' social proof section with heading 'What learners say' featuring three testimonials: 1) 'Stack Teacher's capstone was the reason I got my first cloud role — the mock interviews and code review prepared me.' — Anita R., Cloud Associate, 2) 'From Excel to SQL and a portfolio dashboard — this program gave me a real path to analytics.' — Carlos V., Analytics Engineer, 3) 'Mentor sessions were the difference. Real humans who understood US hiring.' — Priya S., Data Engineer, including headshot, name, role, and city for each testimonial

Create 'How It Works' three-step conversion funnel section with heading 'How the program works' displaying three steps: 1) 'Apply & interview: small cohorts keep mentoring personal.', 2) 'Learn & build: live classes, labs, and mentor feedback.', 3) 'Launch: portfolio, mock interviews, targeted job outreach.', with CTA buttons 'Apply now' and 'Schedule a free call'
Implement lead capture feature for call scheduling integrated into the home page flow, allowing visitors to submit their contact information to schedule a consultation call with Stack Teacher team

Build FAQ section with heading 'Frequently asked questions' containing four questions and answers: 1) 'Is this really beginner-friendly?' with answer 'Yes — our curriculum starts from fundamentals (no prior CS required). Expect 10–15 hours/week.', 2) 'Do you guarantee job placement?' with answer 'No guarantees — we provide structured job support, projects, and interview coaching. Outcomes depend on the student's effort and the market.', 3) 'What language & timezone do cohorts use?' with answer 'All cohorts run in English. We run multiple cohort times (US-friendly evenings and weekend intensives).', 4) 'What makes Stack Teacher different from low-cost courses?' with answer 'Live mentors, verified projects, and focused career support — not just recordings.'

Create footer section with newsletter CTA 'Stay informed: monthly industry brief — AI + Data hiring trends, project spotlights, and scholarship alerts.' with email signup field, footer links (About • Programs • Syllabus • FAQ • Careers • Contact • Privacy), and legal microcopy 'Stack Teacher is an education provider. Course outcomes vary and are not guaranteed.'

Update Layout component to create sticky navigation bar with 'Stack Teacher' brand name in top left corner, navigation links to Infrastructure and Data & Analytics program pages under a 'Programs' dropdown, and Sign Up and Sign In buttons on the right side, ensuring navigation is consistent across all pages

Update App.tsx routing configuration to set home page at route '/', move Infrastructure Accelerator landing page to route '/infrastructure', keep Data & Analytics Accelerator at route '/data-analytics', and maintain application form at route '/apply' and success page at route '/apply/success'

Create a new `/qa-testing` route and landing page for the QA & Software Testing Career Launch Program. The page must compose dedicated section components following the same visual design system, typography, and premium styling as the existing Infrastructure and Data Analytics landing pages.

Build a hero section for the QA landing page with headline 'QA & Software Testing Career Launch Program™', badge/tag '12-Week Intensive | US Market Focused', subheadline 'Break into the tech industry through one of the most accessible entry paths: Quality Assurance.', supporting copy 'No Computer Science degree required. No prior coding experience required.', and a primary CTA button 'Apply for the Next Cohort' linking to /apply.

Build a 'Who This Program Is For' section on the QA landing page listing seven target profiles: career switchers entering tech, business or non-technical graduates, international students in the US, professionals impacted by layoffs, IT support professionals seeking transition, beginners looking for a structured pathway. Include a bold tagline 'This program is focused, fast-paced, and practical.'

Build a 'Why QA Is a Smart Entry Path in the US' section on the QA landing page. Include bullet points: QA roles exist in nearly every tech company; Fintech, healthcare, SaaS, and enterprise firms require strong QA teams; Entry-level QA positions are more accessible than many engineering roles; Automation knowledge increases salary potential. Display salary ranges: Entry-Level QA (US): $60,000–$80,000 and Automation QA (with experience): $90,000+. Include disclaimer 'Results vary by location and performance.'

Build a 3-month curriculum section 'What You Will Learn (12-Week Roadmap)' on the QA landing page with three phases: Month 1 – Foundations of Software Testing (SDLC & Agile methodology, role of QA in modern teams, types of testing — functional/regression/UAT/smoke, writing test cases & test scenarios, bug lifecycle & defect tracking, Jira hands-on); Month 2 – Manual + API Testing (web application testing, mobile testing fundamentals, cross-browser testing, API testing using Postman, JSON basics, test execution reporting; project: complete testing cycle for a demo SaaS application); Month 3 – Automation & Job Preparation (basic Java or Python for QA, Selenium fundamentals, automation test scripts, introduction to CI/CD, Git basics; capstone: Manual + API + Automation mini framework). Include note 'We introduce light coding gradually.' for Month 3.

Build a 'Hands-On Project Experience' section on the QA landing page listing five portfolio deliverables students will complete: a complete test case repository, a defect tracking sample portfolio, API test collection, basic automation scripts, and capstone documentation. Include tagline 'Portfolio-ready material for interviews.'

Build a 'Career Accelerator Layer' section on the QA landing page listing six included services: US-format resume writing, LinkedIn optimization, QA interview question bank, mock interviews, behavioral interview training, job search strategy guidance, and 60-day post-program support. Include messaging 'We prepare you for interviews — not just tools.'

Build a 'Program Format & Time Commitment' section on the QA landing page displaying: Duration: 3 Months (12 Weeks), Weekly Live Sessions, Hands-On Projects, 10–15 hours per week commitment, Cohort-Based, 60-Day Post-Program Support, Selective admission. Include note 'This is not passive learning.'

Build a pricing/investment section on the QA landing page with headline 'Investment', price displayed as '$1,999', note 'Flexible payment options available', and messaging 'This is a focused, structured 12-week career launch program — not just a course.' Include a CTA button 'Apply for the Next Cohort' linking to /apply.

Build a FAQ section on the QA landing page with four questions and answers: 1) 'Is this beginner-friendly?' — Yes. No prior coding required. 2) 'Is automation included?' — Yes, at a foundational level in Month 3. 3) 'Can I get hired after 3 months?' — You will be prepared to apply for entry-level QA roles. Hiring depends on individual effort and market conditions. 4) 'Is this fully online?' — Yes. Live cohort-based format.

Build a final CTA section on the QA landing page with headline 'Your First Step Into Tech Starts Here', copy 'Apply for the next QA cohort. Seats are limited to maintain mentorship quality. Break into tech the accessible way — with structure, support, and real skills.', and a primary CTA button 'Apply for the Next Cohort' linking to /apply.

Add 'QA / Software Testing' as a third option in the program selection dropdown on the /apply application form page. The option value should be 'qa-testing' and the display label should be 'QA & Software Testing Career Launch Program'.

Add QA & Software Testing as a third program card in the Featured Programs section (FeaturedProgramsSection.tsx) on the home page. The card should display: title 'QA & Software Testing Career Launch Program', blurb 'Your first step into tech — manual testing, API testing, automation basics, and job readiness in 12 weeks.', badge 'Entry-Level Gateway', CTA 'View syllabus' linking to /qa-testing, and cohort microcopy 'Next cohort intake — limited seats.'
Update the navigation Programs dropdown in Layout.tsx to include a third link: 'QA & Software Testing' pointing to /qa-testing, positioned below the Infrastructure and Data Analytics links.
Update App.tsx to add the /qa-testing route, rendering the new QA landing page component.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build premium landing page with hero section, program structure, career benefits, and pricing
Add instructor credibility section with real faces and LinkedIn proof
Create FAQ section addressing beginner-friendly concerns and objections
Design clear application CTA and application page
Implement backend storage for application form submissions with fields for applicant name, email, career status, motivation statement, and preferred start date

Create AI Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator landing page with hero section, problem statement, opportunity/salary info, target audience, 5-phase curriculum, projects, career layer, pricing, format, FAQ, and CTA

Update application form backend to accept and distinguish applications for both AI Infrastructure Engineer Accelerator and AI Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator programs by adding a program field to the ApplicationForm type

Create Stack Teacher home page at route '/' with hero section, value proposition, differentiators, featured programs, portfolio showcase, impact counters, company logos, testimonials, how it works, FAQ, and newsletter signup
Implement lead capture feature for call scheduling on home page
Add sticky navigation bar with 'Stack Teacher' brand name in top left corner, Sign Up and Sign In buttons, and links to Infrastructure and Data & Analytics program pages
Update route structure: home page at '/', Infrastructure Accelerator at '/infrastructure', Data & Analytics Accelerator at '/data-analytics'

Create new /qa-testing landing page for QA & Software Testing Career Launch Program (12-week intensive, $1,999, entry-level gateway) with hero, who it's for, salary info, 3-month curriculum, portfolio projects, career accelerator layer, FAQ, and CTA
Add QA / Software Testing as third option in program selection dropdown on /apply page
Add QA as third program card in Featured Programs section on home page, positioned as 'Your First Step into Tech' entry-level gateway
Update navigation Programs dropdown to include QA / Software Testing linking to /qa-testing

Update the backend ApplicationForm type and Program variant in backend/main.mo to include a third program option for QA & Software Testing (e.g., #qaTestingProgram), so form submissions for this program are stored and retrievable correctly.
